data.title: Apple vs. Microsoft: Better Buy
data.text: Which of these two tech giants deserves a place in your portfolio?

data.title: Apple wants to change the way you watch sports
data.text: If Apple Inc. gets its way, you might never miss a sports highlight again.

data.title: Apple Rolls Out First Update to IMac Since 2017
data.text: Apple Inc. introduced the first update to its iMac all-in-one desktop computer since mid-2017. Bloomberg's Mark Gurman reports on "Bloomberg Technology."

data.title: As Apple enters the streaming wars, will Netflix be dethroned?
data.text: The streaming wars heat up, as Apple steps into the ring against Netflix. With CNBC's Melissa Lee and the Fast Money traders, Tim Seymour, Brian Kelly, Steve Grasso and Guy Adami.

data.title: Apple Has Another Huawei Problem
data.text: Apple's iPhone unit shipment woes could cause it to lose clout at a key supplier.

data.title: Revealed: The Key Metric Showing Apple Has Lost Its Innovative Edge
data.text: Is it better to be an innovator or a tastemaker? The answer might surprise you.

data.title: Apple refreshes iMacs with new chips
data.text: It's shaping up to be a busy week for Apple. Yesterday the company unveiled two updated iPads, and today it announced the iMac is getting a minor refresh. Going forward, the 21.5-inch model will be offered with an eighth-gen six-core Intel Core i5 CPU at the high end, plus 4GB AMD Radeon Pro Vega 20 graphics.

data.title: Apple Announces Second Hardware Refresh This Week, Potentially Another Tomorrow
data.text: Following some quiet hardware announcements, the Mac maker's big event next week will focus on services.

data.title: Apple updates its iMacs with faster processors and better graphics
data.text: Apple refreshed its 4K and 5K iMacs on Tuesday with faster processors and better graphics.

data.title: The Apple Heart Study Was Successful at Detecting a Life-Threatening Condition
data.text: Preliminary results indicate the study was a smashing success.

data.title: Apple: Interesting iPad Launch
data.text: With technology giant Apple expected to announce its highly anticipated streaming service next week, rumors have been flying for months about new products that could also come at this event.

data.title: Apple announces new iMacs with greater computing and graphics performance
data.text: Apple Inc. said Tuesday it has updated its iMac lines, which the company boasts will deliver "dramatic increases" in computing and graphics performance.

data.title: Apple streaming service won't offer Netflix subscription, Hastings says
data.text: Netflix Inc.  will not be part of Apple Inc.'s  new streaming service, Chief Executive Reed Hastings said late Monday, Variety reported.

data.title: Calls to Break Up FAANG -- Except This One
data.text: The growing backlash against leading tech companies is reaching a fever pitch. One has notably avoided the spotlight.
